September Newsletter
Introducing story blockers Tracker released Story Blockers <[[https://www.pivotaltracker.com/blog/introducing-story-blockers/]]> to help call out impediments in your backlog and drive the necessary collaboration to remove them and get your progress back on track. The response so far? People are “excited,” calling blockers “excelente” and “amazing,” and concluding, curiously, “This is the role Nicole Kidman was born to play.” Read more <[[https://www.pivotaltracker.com/blog/introducing-story-blockers/]]>
Principles of effective story writing No two people will construct a user story in the same way, but that doesn’t mean there aren’t important guidelines worth following. This post <[[https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/principles-of-effective-story-writing-the-pivotal-labs-way/]]> explores the three most common types of stories that you can create in Pivotal Tracker and the core principles that inform how we write them. Read more <[[https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/principles-of-effective-story-writing-the-pivotal-labs-way/]]>
Prioritizing your roadmap with agile This guest post <[[https://www.pivotaltracker.com/blog/tying-roadmap-strategy-to-agile-planning/]]> from ProductPlan compares the backlog and the roadmap, and looks at several of the better things <[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mXSEc2p5-QA]]> you can do to prioritize the latter. Fear not, agile-loving roadmappers: there is advice for tying these strategies to your agile planning. Read more <[[https://www.pivotaltracker.com/blog/tying-roadmap-strategy-to-agile-planning/]]>
Webinar: Aligning Product Strategy with Customer Feature Requests We’ve all been on customer calls where we’re asked for a feature that just does not align with our product strategy. Join The Product Stack—a supergroup featuring members of ProductPlan, Notion, and Pivotal Tracker—for this free webinar <[[https://register.gotowebinar.com/register/3531068783319339009?source=Tracker&utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=webinar&utm_campaign=august%20newsletter]]> where PM veterans will share real examples of feature requests that did not naturally fit with the company’s vision. Reserve my seat <[[https://register.gotowebinar.com/register/3531068783319339009?source=Tracker&utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=webinar&utm_campaign=august%20newsletter]]>
How to run better IPMs and standups It’s a necessary (and sometimes unpleasant) aspect of modern work life: you’re going to have some meetings. But whether it’s an IPM to set the tone of an iteration <[[https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/three-ways-product-managers-can-help-with-a-great-IPM/]]>, or a Daily Standup to plan the day <[[https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/daily-standup-is-planning-meeting/]]>—not to report on status—these meetings serve a crucial function, and there are ways to make them less onerous and more productive. Read more <[[https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/daily-standup-is-planning-meeting/]]>
Help has arrived Until recently, you had two ways to get answers to Tracker questions—consult our barebones FAQ or contact Support with an S.O.S. <[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cvChjHcABPA]]> No longer! Our new Help Center <[[http://www.pivotaltracker.com/community/tracker-blog/help-is-here]]> has everything you could ever want to know: tips, good practices, troubleshooting advice, and so much more. It’s also fully searchable. Read more <[[http://www.pivotaltracker.com/community/tracker-blog/help-is-here]]>
The fastest-growing companies start slowly While startups lust after first-year growth that looks like a hockey stick, many of the fastest-growing companies start out slowly. Ooshma Garg, the CEO and Founder of Gobble, discusses <[[https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/fastest-growing-companies-start-really-slowly/]]> some of the myths surrounding startup growth. Read more <[[https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/fastest-growing-companies-start-really-slowly/]]>
What is tech debt and how can you avoid it If you’ve spent time on product teams that feel like they’re constantly putting out fires, than you have a good idea of what tech debt is and how disruptive it can be. This Build Tip <[[https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/what-is-tech-debt-and-how-do-you-manage-it/]]> outlines how you can identify and handle it—and why it’s not always a bad thing. Read more <[[https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/what-is-tech-debt-and-how-do-you-manage-it/]]>
